chapter.title: Customer Service Tools
chapter.para: To provide the best possible customer service, your sales associates need to be able to answer all kinds of Customer questions. Fortunately, xTuple POS runs on a powerful database platform which stores transaction history and manages inventory. This means that answers to even the most complicated sales and inventory questions are all available at your fingertips!

section.title: Sales History
section.para: It's common for Customers to have questions about their Sales history. Perhaps you quoted prices to them in the pastâ€”or maybe they want to be reminded of their recent purchases. In the best case scenario, Customers will have their original receipt. But often they will not.

Either way, xTuple POS provides tools for looking up any type of Customer transaction. And, depending on your permission level and xTuple ERP edition, you may be able to uncover detailed information across multiple stores (i.e., Sites). Let's say, for example, you want to find all recent Sales activity for a particular Customer. To do so, follow these steps:

listitem.para: Open the search screen using the following path: Sales > Retail > Retail Sale Search
In the "Search" field, enter the Customer's last name (e.g., "Smith")
The following screen shows the results we get:

tip.para: If you have a copy of an original Sales receipt, simply enter the receipt number in the "Search" field to quickly locate the Sales transaction.

section.title: Item Availability
section.para: Another common question Customers ask is whether you have a specific Item available in stock. With xTuple POS, you can quickly research an Item using the Inventory Availability by Item screen. To access the Inventory Availability screen, follow these steps:

listitem.para: Follow this path: Inventory > Reports > Inventory Availability > by Item
In the "Item Number" field, enter the Item Number
Specify the Site you are researching

note.para: If you are using xTuple ERP Standard Edition or Manufacturing Edition, you can search for Inventory across multiple Sites.

listitem.para: The following screen shows sample results:

section.para: As you can see in our example, we learned there are 30 units of Item YTRUCK1 currently available at our Site ST1. If we had chosen to view availability at All Sites, we could have gotten an even wider view of Item availability.

tip.para: You can also can identify Items that are currently on order by right-clicking on the Item. In this way, you can find out further details regarding estimated delivery of order.
